issue.title: `compute_params_filterbank` should be simpler

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
The current code for `compute_params_filterbank` is messy and its documentation is outdated. It says it returns dictionaries where in fact it returns list.

It just came to my attention that we don't need dictionaries at all in this part of the code, and can make everything flow with 18 lines of code

```python
xi_max = compute_xi_max(Q)
sigma_max = compute_sigma_psi(xi_max, Q, r=r_psi)

if sigma_max <= sigma_min:
    xis = []
    sigmas = []
    elbow_xi = sigma_max
else:
    xis =  [xi_max]
    sigmas = [sigma_max]

    # High-frequency (constant-Q) region: geometric progression of xi
    while sigmas[-1] > (sigma_min * math.pow(2, 1/Q)):
        xis.append(xis[-1] / math.pow(2, 1/Q))
        sigmas.append(sigmas[-1] / math.pow(2, 1/Q))
    elbow_xi = xis[-1]

# Low-frequency (constant-bandwidth) region: arithmetic progression of xi
for q in range(1, Q):
    xis.append(elbow_xi - q/Q * elbow_xi)
    sigmas.append(sigma_min)

js = list(map(get_max_dyadic_subsampling, xis, sigmas, repeat(alpha)))
return xis, sigmas, js
```
    
instead of the 30 lines that we currently have. We can also remove the private function `_move_one_dyadic_step`, so this issue aligns with the overarching goal of simplifying `filter_bank.py`: #227, #513, #825, #833 ...

issue.title: MAINT Simplify `filter_bank.py`

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
closes https://github.com/kymatio/kymatio/issues/825
fewer lines, shorter docs, faster tests

* remove P_max=5, eps=1e-7, and normalize="l1" from Scattering1D object
* this lightens the kwarg lists of scattering_filter_factory and calibrate_scattering_filters
* unify morlet_1d and gauss_1d algorithms
* delete get_normalizing factors

supersedes #831 and #832
many thanx to @MuawizChaudhary

issue.title: `calibrate_scattering_filters` is unnecessary

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
`calibrate_scattering_filters` is probably my least favorite function from `filter_bank.py`. It it called only ~once~ thrice, and has no units test. It has six inputs, seven (!) outputs, and only five lines of code. (and 50 lines of docs!)

In the spirit of #513, i suggest we remove it and have  `scattering_filter_factory` call `compute_filter_params` directly.

body: i've reduced the number of functions to 10 and brought `filter_bank` under 500 lines (docs included). We could reduce the codebase even more in the future but i would say that this is an good milestone. Closing.
